meanings.definition: The quality or state of being intrepid.
meanings.sent1: Her intrepidities in the face of danger inspired everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: His intrepidities on the battlefield earned him the respect of his comrades.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's intrepidities in stealing nuts from the bird feeder amused the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The explorer's intrepidities in the uncharted jungle were like a beacon of courage to his team.
meanings.sent5: The intrepidities of the firefighter rushing into the burning building will forever be remembered.

meanings.definition: Boldness or fearlessness in facing danger or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: The intrepidities of the climber as she scaled the treacherous cliff were truly remarkable.
meanings.sent2: Facing the storm with intrepidities, the captain guided the ship to safety.
meanings.sent3: The cat's intrepidities in chasing a much larger dog around the yard provided comic relief for the family.
meanings.sent4: Her intrepidities in speaking up for what she believed in were like a shining light in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The intrepidities of the young knight facing the dragon were etched in the annals of history.
